text: Donald Herod Peterson (October 22, 1933 - May 27, 2018) was an American astronaut. He was born in Winona, Mississippi. == Career == Peterson was a United States Air Force officer and NASA astronaut. Peterson was selected for the Manned Orbiting Laboratory (MOL) program, but, when that was canceled, he became a NASA astronaut in September 1969. He was a mission specialist on STS-6 on board Challenger. During the mission Peterson performed a spacewalk to test the new airlock and space suits. He logged 120 hours in space. Peterson retired from NASA in 1984. == Death == Peterson died on May 27, 2018 at his home in El Lago, Texas of Alzheimer's disease and bone cancer at the age of 84. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1933 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Deaths from bone cancer Category:Disease-related deaths in Texas Category:Cancer deaths in Texas Category:American astronauts Category:Military people from Mississippi Category:Scientists from Mississippi Category:People from Winona, Mississippi
title: Donald H. Peterson
